headline.main: Inaction of the Common Council in Relation to the Streets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The entire month of July passed away without the Board of Councilmen having taken any final action upon the specifications which have already been adopted by the Board of Aldermen in relation to cleaning the streets of the City.
docs.snippet: The entire month of July passed away without the Board of Councilmen having taken any final action upon the specifications which have already been adopted by the Board of Aldermen in relation to cleaning the streets of the City.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have another arrival from Mormondom. An emigrant train, containing a large number of women and children--one hundred persons in all--has just reached this city, after a wearisome journey of sixty days. The train consisted of fifteen teams, and brought through a large and valuable collection of beaver and buffalo furs.
docs.abstract: Power of resistance on the part of the Mormons

headline.main: BEPEAL MEETING IN THE NINTH WARD.; Democratic Rally--Letter from Mayor Wood--Fireworks and a General Good Time.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Democratic forces of the Ninth Ward assembled last night at the corner of Hudson and Barrow streets, as the allied forces of Great Britain and France assembled lately before Sevastopol, only not quite so numerous, and not altogether so in rapid. docs.lead_paragraph: A HOP AT BATH.--A pleasant affair came off at the Bath Hotel, Sea Side, L. I. on Saturday night. The guests of the house, who are visiting Bath equally for health and enjoyment, thinking doubtless that they would advance more rapidly on the road to the latter by a series of "hops," determined during the week to india'e their Terpsichorean entertainments at its close. LTON'S band was sent for:

docs.lead_paragraph: FATAL ACCIDENT,--PHILIP CARR, residing at the corner of Van Brunt and Carroll Streets, met with an accident on Sunday afternoon, which caused his immediate death. He fell from the fourth s ory of the house , No. 16 Summit-street.

headline.main: Unsuccessful Attempt to Dodge Quarantine--Hides and Skins at Green Port, L. I.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the following communication it will be seen that some of our ship-owners are quite systematically at work trying to introduce into our port infected or putrid cargoes, in violation of our Health Laws. The move in question was entirely unsuccessful. It is true, they brought their vessel without trouble to the wharves of Green Port,

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; City Mortality. SUPREME COURT

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is the WEEKLY REPORT OF DEATHS in the City and County of New-York, from the 25th day of July, to the 1st day of August, 1857: Men, 73 women, 40; boys, 2:9; girls, 190; total, 531. Adults, 322; children, 409; males, 292; females, 239; colored persons, 12.

headline.main: HONDURAS.; EXPLORATIONS AND ADVENTURES IN HONDURAS, Comprising Skatches of Travel in the Gold Regions of Olanchou, and Review of the History and General Resources of Central America, with original maps and numerous illustrations. By WILLIAM V. WELLS New-York: HARPER & BROTHERS, 1857.

docs.lead_paragraph: While HENNINGSEN and WALKAR are preparing for another foray upon Central America, for the benefit of the newsmongers, we may employ this very dull interval of raising funds and fitting out our vessel against Costa Rica, in a little profitable reading. Another batch of glorious victories will arrive in good time, with the usual contradictions and qualifications.
